meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Evan Nolan Mary Harris Michelle LaLonde Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6357.

td.p: Evan Nolan, a contract attorney from Winchester, Massachusetts
Mary Harris, a knitting store owner from Seattle, Washington
Michelle LaLonde, a law librarian from Novi, Michigan (whose 1-day cash winnings total $18,500)

tr.td: THEY WROTE FOR ENCYCLOPEDIA BRITANNICA
WILL SMITH MOVIES
WHAT MAKES IT GO?
COWBOY TALK
A SINGLE TREE
ENDS WITH "W"

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Marie Curie\'s 1926 entry on this element said one could use it to make luminous paints to use in watches')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: Marie Curie's 1926 entry on this element said one could use it to make luminous paints to use in watches

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_4_4', 'clue_J_4_4_stuck', '[The end-of-round signal sounds.]
(Alex: And that gives you $3,200 at the end of the round. You\'re still in third place, which means you get to go first in the Double Jeopardy! Round when we come back after this.)
[The contestants laugh as Alex realizes that the shark from clue #21 is swimming through the air behind him.]
[The sizzler clip for the week on jeopardy.com showed Alex subsequently boxing the shark in the nose.]

plug

Michelle
')

tr.td: Michelle
Mary
Evan
PIG LATIN LATIN
(Alex: ...you must respond in Pig Latin.)
NUMERICAL TITLES
CELEBRITY NAMES
I'VE GOT 2 TICKETS TO PARADISE
PACK YOUR BAGS
WE'LL LEAVE TONIGHT
